event

Class Event

  • java.lang.Object
    • event.Event

  • public class Event
extends java.lang.Object

    Event

    This class implements and Event object for tracking personalized events in a calendar.

    Created on 1 October 2020

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Event(java.lang.String name, java.time.LocalDate date, java.time.LocalTime startTime, java.time.LocalTime endTime, java.lang.String description, java.lang.String location, boolean repeats)
      Constructs an event.
      Event(java.lang.String name, java.time.LocalDate date, java.time.LocalTime startTime, java.time.LocalTime endTime, java.lang.String description, java.lang.String location, boolean repeats, java.time.LocalDate startDate, java.time.LocalDate endDate, boolean[][] repetitionMask)
      Constructs an event.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Event

        public Event(java.lang.String name,
             java.time.LocalDate date,
             java.time.LocalTime startTime,
             java.time.LocalTime endTime,
             java.lang.String description,
             java.lang.String location,
             boolean repeats,
             java.time.LocalDate startDate,
             java.time.LocalDate endDate,
             boolean[][] repetitionMask)
        Constructs an event. This constructor should be called when the event is meant to repeat.
        Parameters:
        name - - The name of the event.
        date - - The first date the event is to occur on.
        startTime - - The starting time of the event.
        endTime - - The ending time of the event.
        description - - a user specified description of the event.
        location - - a user specified location of the event.
        repeats - - True if the event is set to repeat, false otherwise.
        startDate - - The first date the event is to occur on when repeated.
        endDate - - The final date the event is to occur on when repeated.
        repetitionMask - - A two dimensional array storing information about how the event is going to repeat.

      • Event

        public Event(java.lang.String name,
             java.time.LocalDate date,
             java.time.LocalTime startTime,
             java.time.LocalTime endTime,
             java.lang.String description,
             java.lang.String location,
             boolean repeats)
        Constructs an event. This constructor should be called when the event is not meant to repeat.
        Parameters:
        name - - The name of the event.
        date - - The first date the event is to occur on.
        startTime - - The starting time of the event.
        endTime - - The ending time of the event.
        description - - a user specified description of the event.
        location - - a user specified location of the event.
        repeats - - True if the event is set to repeat, false otherwise.

        public java.time.LocalDate getDate()
        This method returns the date of the event.
        Returns:
        the first date the event is to occur on.

      • getStartDate

        public java.time.LocalDate getStartDate()
        This method returns the startDate of the event. This field is only initialized if the event is set to repeat.
        Returns:
        the first date the event is to occur on.

      • getEndDate

        public java.time.LocalDate getEndDate()
        This method returns the endDate of the event. This field is only initialized if the event is set to repeat.
        Returns:
        the final date the event is to occur on.

      • summary

        public java.lang.String summary()
        This method returns a formatted string representing a summary of this event.
        Returns:
        a summary of this event.

      • getRepetitonWeeksLength

        public int getRepetitonWeeksLength()
        This method returns how many weeks it takes for the events repetition pattern to begin repeating itself.
        Returns:
        the number of weeks in the repetition cycle of this event.

      • getMaskValue

        public boolean getMaskValue(int row,
                            int column)
        This method returns the mask value of repetitionMask at index (row, column);
        Parameters:
        row - - the row index of the mask value to retrieve.
        column - - the column index of the mask value to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the mask value of repetitionMask at index (row, column);

        public java.util.UUID getID()
        This method returns a unique ID associated with this event.
        Returns:
        this ID.
